meanings.definition: To end the life of a person or animal in a painless way as a means of ending suffering.
meanings.sent1: The kind veterinarian euthanizes sick animals to stop their pain.
meanings.sent2: The doctor euthanizes the old dog to prevent further suffering.
meanings.sent3: The zookeeper jokingly said he would euthanize the broken coffee machine.
meanings.sent4: In the movie, the hero euthanizes the evil robot to save the city.
meanings.sent5: The wise wizard euthanizes the cursed tree to restore peace to the forest.

meanings.definition: To administer a lethal dose of medication to end the life of a patient.
meanings.sent1: The nurse euthanizes the terminally ill patient to ease their pain.
meanings.sent2: The hospice worker euthanizes the suffering patient with their consent.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that too much salt could euthanize the taste of the soup.
meanings.sent4: The detective felt like the truth would euthanize the lies in the case.
meanings.sent5: The poison euthanizes the weeds in the garden, keeping it tidy.
